newsitem.title: SLOVAKIA: SLOVAKS REVISE DOWNWARD '96 GRAIN CROP FORECAST.
newsitem.headline: SLOVAKS REVISE DOWNWARD '96 GRAIN CROP FORECAST.

text.p: The Slovak Statistical Bureau (SUSR) on Tuesday said it had revised downwards its 1996 grain harvest forecast to 2.64-2.71 million tonnes, from a previous estimate of 2.77-2.82 million tonnes.
The latest estimate is a result of the third grain crop test this year as of August 15.
SUSR said the latest crop estimate stood 7.4 percent lower
than last year's crop of 2.89 million tonnes.
"As oppposed to the previous estimate, the latest one
expects a lower yield, which has effected the whole crop," the
SUSR said in a statement.
The average grain yield estimate fell to 3.81 tonnes, from
a previous estimate of 3.92 tonnes.
This year's grain harvest is "considersably" delayed
compared to the last year, due to unfavourable rainy whether,
the bureau added.
SLOVAK GRAIN CROP ESTIMATES Aug 15 '96 July 15 '96
(in thousands of tonnes)
-- Bratislava Newsroom, 42-7-210-3687
